title: Arkansas Post National Memorial: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           1741 Old Post Road  Gillett, AR 72055                 Directions         Arkansas Post National Memorial is located in southeastern Arkansas. The entrance to the park is on Arkansas Hwy 169, seven miles south of Gillett, via US Hwy 165 (The Great River Road), and about 20 miles northeast of Dumas, via US 165.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Visitor Center The visitor center is open daily from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. The visitor center is closed Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day.   Standard Hours    Sunday: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Monday: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Tuesday: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Wednesday: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Thursday: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Friday: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Saturday: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM     Park Entrance  Grounds Hours The park grounds are open daily: 8:00 a.m. to dark.   Standard Hours    Sunday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Monday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Tuesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Wednesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Thursday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Friday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Saturday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM             Weather           Arkansas shares the same climate classification as the rest of the southeastern United States: humid subtropical. This type of climate features relatively mild winters and hot, steamy summers.          Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   Park Fees - $0.00 There is no entrance fee to visit the park.         Visitor Centers
